pros:
I have always been treated as an family member at Zopper.

Our management is always open to suggestions & questionnaires from each & every employee keeping aside there role & responsibility.

 It has always been a great feeling working in such a friendly environment.

headline: I have been working at Zopper  full-time for more than 2 years
pros: Open culture, good work environment, supportive senior management. Employee friendly policies. User centric support functions, Facilities, easy approachable management, lots of learning and growth opportunity. Future of the merged entity looks great.

headline: A place to evolve
pros:
COVID has changed the whole system of working environment across the world. Zopper is one of the organisation which has adapted the new change very efficienctly. I joined 3 weeks back and I have been absorbed by the organisation and colleagues in easiest way possible.
1. Smooth Onboarding - Whole process was online (video/voice call)
2. Structured HR policies - Information about Leaves, Insurance and other benefits have been shared in a well formatted way.
3.Colleagues - Colleagues have been really helpful in making me understand both culture and work
4.Management- Constant support from higher management in every possible way
5.Work Opportunities - Company is 9 years old and the new domain where it is expanding is 8 months old, so there is a great mixture of stability of an established company and an energy of a start-up.

PS: It's been only 3 weeks for me here but when I see the volume of my learnings I got the no. seems to lie.
cons: None that I found till now

headline: I want to rate -5, but there is no option.
pros:
If you are expert in "Chatukarita" then you can stay there it for long time.
Didn't find any.
cons:
There is lot, if i will start writing it will take approx 10 days or more.
1. Lies start with the first day of joining, In offer letter leave policies, it was mentioned as discussed with HR. HR said 1.5CL and 1.5 PL. as for all Employes.
But after 3-4 Months I got sick and applied leave for 5 days on Portal and approved. Finally Salary day came. I had received a Salary with Deduction. After enquiry HR told 6 Month Provisional Period and you can have only 1 Leave/Month.(BIGGEST SHOCK).
After that i had asked for previous months leave. They told Leaves will be collapsed after every month. What a ....
This was the First Shock.
2.
3.
4.
You sholud have to "Chatu" For approval of Leaves and any ather  work.
Else your leaves will not get approved and your approved leaves get canceled.
Managers dont care how typical situation is there for you.
They Dont care if someone got admitted to hospital and and Dead.
May be Your Best Friend Wedding, even if you have informed senior management 1-2 month Before. Your approved leaved got rejected.
And the .... Replay from managers==>>
"Ask them to change the date of Hospital Admition, OR Dead OR Marriage"
Now You Guys only think what type of Managers are there and what type of Management is there.
The Same Day I had Resigned. And Resignation Approved - Next Day Releaved.

:) Really Happy...
.
.
.
nth. This is the Last Shock.
While Resignation They had told for 40-45 days for Complete Full and Final.
Its almost Many months has gone, they are not able to complete my Full and Final.

FINAL CONCLUSION:- Dont try To work to hard, as many people works 12-14 hours a day.
Just Work  for Hours mentioned in Joining. and follow the Joining Letter Terms.
and if some thing Miss happens, Just axcillate the Matter and Mail to all and dont forget to keep your Personal ID in CC.
Because You Office ID can BE blocked Any Time.

8. Warranty for electronics high ticket and medium sizes products (offered, closed and again running with a gap of 2 years). Least bothered when proposition closed and clients approached for service no number was working to check their warranty and claim applications procedure.
9. All major store signed up with zopper and cancelled contracts within 6 months
10. Management try and fail, but they are least bothered for resource who are recruited for their trials. They ask to resign and are very bad administrators. Mgmt failed in their last 3 businesses they ventured

headline: Nice company to work with.
pros:
Zopper is a transparent organization and almost every one is approachable with a open door policy. It’s a young organization that creates a vibrant atmosphere to work. Seniors are particularly very supportive and listen to your ideas. You can learn a lot in the company. Good work is always recognized and appreciated.

I am working with Zopper from more than a year in Operations Team.
cons: In last one year i am not able to figure out any.

headline: Their can't be a better place and people
pros:
Things told by people at different phases of life "professional world is ruthless", "private sector is unsecured and unkind",  "colleagues can't become friends", I really want to meet these people and tell them on their faces that their advices have been totally worthless, which will demotivate a human.  I want all these people (if they have enough guts) to work with a company like Zopper. 
I can't believe that their would be any other company that gives so much freedom and responsibility to its employees. Zopper stands for everything that can our country be proud of- Ethics, Passion, Purpose, Innovation, Sensitivity towards others and more importantly thinking big. 
Ups and downs are part of everyones life ("I have lost my right to be happy all the time"- Paul Celho), and we at Zopper also are not immune to it, but, with the support of mentors, seniors and colleagues we overcome all such phases.

Some of my ex-colleagues and current colleagues have become friends for life, and I myself do not want to work anywhere else either it has to be Zopper or my own venture.
cons:
I get to meat only once in a week, we can have it more often for lunch.
A treadmill for burning extra calories that some of our colleagues consume through Cakes, Samosas and Jalebis (I don't need it, as I myself am a fitness freak)

headline: Good for freshers that too IIT'ans
pros:
Zopper seemed to be a decent startup in the beginning. Only developers are well-paid that too IIT'ians. 

Not a place for content writers or people working in digital marketing. A big NO for them.
cons:
Zopper seemed to be a decent startup in the beginning. But later it went really bad. They are expert in luring their employees by giving parties and perks only to developers(Tech team). Marketing team is always neglected. Don't know why?? 

I think they highly believe in the hiring and firing policy. But anyways every start-up can't be a Flipkart or Snapdeal.
